channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Mary Ward
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: COVIDSafe app goes live as global COVID-19 cases near 3 million, Australian death toll stands at 83

item.dc:creator: Marissa Calligeros
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus live updates Victoria: More than 1m Australians download COVIDSafe app as global cases near 3 million; Australian death toll stands at 83

item.description: North Korea's "cult-driven system" makes it essential to have a family member in charge, and Kim Jo-yong "has shown that she knows how to exercise authority."
item.title: Will a woman run North Korea? Kim Yo-jong outshines male rivals

item.description: Some signs of life have emerged from the North Korean presidency after weeks of speculation about Kim Jong-un's health.
item.title: Kim Jong-un mystery deepens as North Korea releases 'statement'

item.description: A truck driver has been charged with culpable driving over the Eastern Freeway crash that killed four police officers on Wednesday night.
item.title: Truck driver charged over Eastern Freeway horror crash

item.dc:creator: Rob Harris
item.description: Health authorities are expecting more than half of all Australians to download the voluntary COVIDSafe contact tracing app.
item.title: Workers urged to download app to kick-start post-COVID-19 economy

item.dc:creator: Riley Wilson
item.description: The long-lost art of letter-writing has become a part of daily life for many Australians, who are relishing the opportunity to reconnect.
item.title: Pen to paper for newly minted postal correspondents

item.description: Follow our rolling coverage.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, April 24, 2020

item.description: The latest work by Sydney Morning Herald editorial cartoonist Cathy Wilcox.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Cathy Wilcox

item.description: A selection of his best work.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Matt Davidson

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted in the work of our award-winning cartoonists.
item.title: Today's cartoons: The illustrated news

item.dc:creator: Dana McCauley
item.description: The sector wants updated national guidelines that enshrine a right to control access to facilities.
item.title: Aged care operators push back at PM's order to allow visitors

item.description: Some of his best work
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Andrew Dyson

item.dc:creator: Matt Wade
item.description: Spending habits forged during the coronavirus lockdown are set to permanently reshape consumer behaviour in Australia.
item.title: New lockdown spending habits will outlive the coronavirus pandemic

item.description: An Anzac Day like no other gave us the chance to honour those who served in a new way, renewing the solemnity of the occasion.
item.title: Isolated Anzac Day offers new hope, old reminders

item.dc:creator: Andrew Charlton
item.description: Those on the lowest incomes usually bear the brunt of recessions and we must seek to stop it happening again.
item.title: Virus to broaden financial inequality

item.dc:creator: Peter Hannam
item.description: Many regions have had good recent falls but the big dams have yet to fill. That may change as the outlook shifts to favour a wetter than usual winter.
item.title: 'Ready to go': Drought's end in sight after rains and more to come

item.dc:creator: Matt O'Sullivan
item.description: Internal polling shows a boost in public attitudes towards the second stage, sparking calls for the government to come clean on whether it will build it.
item.title: Support grows for construction of Parramatta light rail second stage

item.dc:creator: Anthony Galloway
item.description: A senior World Health Organisation official has welcomed the government's move to push for a global review of the COVID-19 outbreak.
item.title: WHO backs Australian move to ease restrictions

item.dc:creator: Nick Bonyhady
item.description: The pandemic has pushed the government and unions unusually close, but some Liberals see broad industrial changes as key to a post-pandemic recovery.
item.title: Liberals push government to stay the course on industrial relations

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: Doctors have written in the Medical Journal of Australia calling for a toolkit to help GPs decide whether an elderly person should have a driver's license.
item.title: GPs call for toolkit to help assess older people's driving ability

item.description: Free daily horoscope for each star sign from renowned Astrologer Hedy Damari. Forecasts for the week ahead in life, love and career.
item.title: Your Daily Horoscope for Monday, April 27

item.dc:creator: Matt Wade
item.description: Spending is falling fastest in some of Sydney's wealthiest areas since the onset of the coronavirus pandemic, while those in some less well-off districts are purchasing more.
item.title: Sydney's shopping divide: wealthy suburbs cut back, others spend up

item.dc:creator: Melissa Cunningham
item.description: Being unable to hold your loved one’s hand or kiss them goodbye as they die alone in a hospital bed is perhaps the most brutal and devastating hallmark of coronavirus.
item.title: 'No one dies alone': Hospitals look for solutions to connect dying COVID-19 patients with families

item.dc:creator: Rob Harris
item.description: The nation's leaders are being urged to prioritise large-scale home-building investments in the months ahead to help aid economic recovery
item.title: Private-sector, charities push for social housing-led economic recovery

item.dc:creator: Penny Wong
item.description: Labor's foreign affairs spokeswoman writes that the coronavirus has complicated already delicate relations with China - but we must preserve the relationship, guided by our values and our interests.
item.title: We need to rethink our China relationship, but disengagement is no option

item.dc:creator: Sean Kelly
item.description: There is little chance of Labor persuading voters that Scott Morrison got it wrong on coronavirus, but the Opposition Leader is onto something when he calls for an economy that works for the people, not the other way around.
item.title: Why Morrison needs to keep Albanese sidelined

item.dc:creator: Zoe Samios
item.description: The NSW government has removed legislation that requires local councils to publish notices in newspapers.
item.title: Local newspapers suffer another blow with loss of council business

item.description: Consumers in Melbourne's most affluent suburbs have tightened their purse strings the most in the past month, new data reveals.
item.title: Melbourne's wealthiest suburbs tighten belts as shopping malls get busy

item.dc:creator: Alexandra Smith
item.description: Clubs and RSLs say they have ample space in their buildings to ensure people can maintain social distancing measures.
item.title: Clubs' plea to Premier: We need to reopen or many will not recover

item.dc:creator: Zoe Samios
item.description: News Corp is planning a major restructure of its business.
item.title: News Corp calls in Deloitte for major restructure

item.dc:creator: Michaela Whitbourn
item.description: Australian Financial News director David Han told the Federal Court he published the defamatory article without reading it first.
item.title: Media outlet pays former Macquarie banker $350,000 to settle fight

item.dc:creator: Patrick Hatch
item.description: Virgin Australia's administrators face a mammoth task dealing with owners of the collapsed airline's planes, with one lessor already raising concerns about one of its jets remaining in the sky.
item.title: Virgin Australia administrators face mammoth task with aircraft owners

item.dc:creator: Genevieve Rota
item.description: If you like TV that keeps your heart racing and your palms sweaty, these crime capers are for you.
item.title: Five edge-of-your-seat British crime dramas you can watch now

item.dc:creator: Cara Waters
item.description: Beauty therapists are being asked by customers to disregard the government ban on operating.
item.title: 'I won't say anything': Beauty therapists under pressure to defy restrictions

item.dc:creator: Tammy Mills
item.description: Perpetrators are "weaponising" the health crisis to control their victims as the Victorian courts' family violence service reports dramatic jump in calls.
item.title: Family violence perpetrators 'threaten to expose children to COVID-19'

item.dc:creator: Caitlin Fitzsimmons
item.description: Australians are drinking less sugar, trading soft drink and juice for water, milk and kombucha, a new study suggests.
item.title: Sugary drink consumption 'still way too high' despite long-term decline

item.dc:creator: Zoe Samios
item.description: Seven West Media's television revenue has fallen by $42 million in the first quarter, but the worst is yet to come.
item.title: Seven's revenue falls as media companies struggle

item.dc:creator: Dominic Powell
item.description: A fierce battle is brewing between Australia's retailers and their multi-billion dollar landlords
item.title: Retailers and landlords seek 'common ground' as negotiations threaten to turn ugly

item.dc:creator: Nick Toscano
item.description: As coronavirus spreads, Newmont chief executive Tom Palmer is hunkering down in a Perth townhouse while he steers the world's top gold miner through unprecedented times.
item.title: From corner office to 'broom closet': How top gold CEO works from home

item.description: With Saigon about to topple at the hands of communist troops, Vietnamese students at the University of NSW begged the Government to ease restrictions so that their relatives could enter Australia.
item.title: From the Archives, 1975: 'Save our families - don't let them be killed'

item.dc:creator: Cara Waters
item.description: Business owners are battling staff demanding JobKeeper payments but refusing to work.
item.title: ‘It’s not money for jam’: Staff refusing to come to work but demanding JobKeeper payments

item.dc:creator: Michael Idato
item.description: Corey Stoll came to Billions straight from Shakespeare's power play Macbeth. The two worlds are connected, he says.
item.title: Corey Stoll is a Prince among thieves in the new season of Billions

item.dc:creator: Kerrie O'Brien
item.description: These feel-good family movies, made in the 1960s, reflect a different world.
item.title: Top five: nostalgic '60s musicals for feel-good family viewing

item.dc:creator: Stephanie Bull
item.description: Tom Uglys Bridge opens, new speed record, and a wombat at Diggers’ ball
item.title: In the Herald: April 27, 1929

item.dc:creator: Sarah Berry
item.description: With gyms closed around the country, workout schedules have been thrown out. The good news? It won't take long for your body to kick back into gear.
item.title: Muscle memory means you won't lose fitness gains in lockdown

item.description: The day's burning issues as seen through the eyes of the Herald's cartoonists.
item.title: Editorial cartoon

item.dc:creator: Michael Chammas
item.description: Secrets and sprays will be exposed as part of a brave plan from NRL coaches to be mic'd up on game day.
item.title: NRL coaches prepared to be mic'd up in game time

item.dc:creator: Georgina Robinson
item.description: A missed text message and a wavering telco will continue to cause headaches for Rugby Australia, which is reeling from Raelene Castle's sudden exit.
item.title: 'Shameful': Ten slams RA board over Castle exit as Optus delays talks
